The short term goal is to develop a vehicle to lift Prospector above 70km. But if that was all there was to it, I\'d just slap together a big rocket in ten minutes or so and it\'d be done with no fuss.

The long term goal complicates this program. The long term goal is to create an entire line of reusable spaceplane launch vehicles, that will boost a variety of payloads into space and then return for an airplane-style gliding landing. I also want to keep the launch spaceplanes intact as much as possible, meaning no disposable boosters and/or fuel tanks if I can help it.

The even longer term goal is to tell a story... a *long* story. And that goal is the most interesting one to me. I will deliberately complicate and obfuscate all manner of details to further that goal. That\'s why doing things the most efficient way isn\'t a high priority.

What I find interesting about your GRUNT design is that it falls prey to the same mistakes as the Space Shuttle. All the different parts would make it expensive to produce and upkeep as well as greatly increasing the danger of spontaneous failure. On top of that the amount it put\'s into orbit is not that great for it\'s cost. A spaceX like vehicle with identical parts for decreased manufacturing costs would be much more efficient.
